intro: Psychotria albicaulis, commonly known as the "white-flowered psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and dark green, elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests. Psychotria albicaulis is notable for its role in the ecosystem and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
